Class AbstractCar

  • java.lang.Object
    • AbstractCar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Car
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LargeCar, SmallCar

    public abstract class AbstractCar
extends java.lang.Object
implements Car
    The AbstractCar implements the Car interface and implements all the common fields and behavior shared by all cars. The drive method remains abstract, as it requires unique implementations based on different fuel consumption rates.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractCar

        public AbstractCar(int tankCapacity,
                   int consumptionRate)
        Constructor for AbstractCar. TankCapacity and a rate of consumption are required fields. New Cars default to having a full tank, are not rented, and have a unique registration number assigned upon creation.
        Parameters:
        tankCapacity - A tank capacity in litres
        consumptionRate - Rate that the car consumes fuel at (KM/L)

        Returns:
        A number representing how much fuel is still left in the tank.

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Returns true if the tank is full, i.e. if the tank capacity is equal to the amount of fuel in the tank.
        Specified by:
        isFull in interface Car
        Returns:
        True if full, false if not full.

      • isRented

        public boolean isRented()
        Returns true if the car is currently rented. Set to false by default.
        Specified by:
        isRented in interface Car
        Returns:
        True if rented, false if not rented.

      • setRentalStatus

        public void setRentalStatus(boolean status)
        A set method for rental status.
        Specified by:
        setRentalStatus in interface Car
        Parameters:
        status - True to set the car as rented, false to set as not rented.

      • addFuel

        public int addFuel(int fuelToAdd)
        Allows the car's fuel to be refilled. Only allows the tank to be filled if the car is not full, and not rented (car's tank should be filled upon being returned, so should be full if set to not rented).
        Specified by:
        addFuel in interface Car
        Parameters:
        fuelToAdd - The amount of fuel to be added to the tank.
        Returns:
        The amount of fuel actually added i.e. if the tank was almost full it will return the amount that could actually be added.

      • drive

        public abstract int drive(int distanceInKM)
        Abstract method to be implemented by concrete subclasses. Should check that tank isn't empty, car is rented. Fuel must decrement based on distance and fuel consumption rate. Fuel consumed, rounded up to nearest whole number should be returned.
        Specified by:
        drive in interface Car
        Parameters:
        distanceInKM - The distance to drive.
        Returns:
        The fuel consumed.
